poetry1: The country is shattered, yet mountains and rivers remain; In the city, spring comes, and the grass and trees are deep.
poetry2: Moved by the times, flowers shed tears; Anguished by parting, birds startle the heart.
poetry3: The beacon fires have burned for three months, A letter from home is worth ten thousand pieces of gold.
poetry4: With white hair scratched even shorter, I can hardly hold my hairpin in place.
